com.orange.labs.sdk.session

Class AuthSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.orange.labs.sdk.session.AuthSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Session

    public class AuthSession
extends java.lang.Object
implements Session
    Class to authenticate Orange user via a web site thanks to OAuth protocol.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthSession

        public AuthSession(Context context,
                   java.lang.String appKey,
                   java.lang.String appSecret,
                   java.lang.String redirectURI)
        Create a new session to authenticate Android apps with the given app key pair. The session will not be linked because it has no access token or secret.
        Parameters:
        context - Activity context
        appKey - The application key (http://api.orange.com to get it)
        appSecret - The application secret (http://api.orange.com to get it)
        redirectURI - The redirect uri (http://api.orange.com to get it)

      • addScope

        public void addScope(java.lang.String scope)
        Description copied from interface: Session
        Right to be granted by the user for an Api. Each Api can populate scope. For example, Cloud Api add 'cloud' scope.
        Specified by:
        addScope in interface Session
        Parameters:
        scope - scope for identity populate by an Api.

        Returns:

        Description copied from interface: Session
        Refresh a session thanks to refresh token
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface Session
        Parameters:
        success - Listener called when session has been refreshed
        failure - Listener called when error occurred

      • startAuthentication

        public void startAuthentication()
        Start authentication. If needed, launch AuthActivity allowing an user authentication else wait to check authentication with refresh token checkAuthentication(com.orange.labs.sdk.OrangeListener.Success, com.orange.labs.sdk.OrangeListener.Error)

      • checkAuthentication

        public void checkAuthentication(OrangeListener.Success<java.lang.String> success,
                                OrangeListener.Error failure)
        Check if authentication is successful. Get the access Token thanks to authorization code or refresh token.
        Parameters:
        success - Listener in case of success
        failure - Listener in case of error
